user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_io_block_set:
```c
int metal_io_block_set(struct metal_io_region *io, unsigned long offset,
	       unsigned char value, int len)
{
	unsigned char *ptr = metal_io_virt(io, offset);
	int retlen = len;

	if (!ptr)
		return -ERANGE;
	if ((offset + len) > io->size)
		len = io->size - offset;
	retlen = len;
	if (io->ops.block_set) {
		(*io->ops.block_set)(
			io, offset, value, memory_order_seq_cst, len);
	} else {
		unsigned int cint = value;
		unsigned int i;

		for (i = 1; i < sizeof(int); i++)
			cint |= ((unsigned int)value << (CHAR_BIT * i));

		for (; len && ((uintptr_t)ptr % sizeof(int)); ptr++, len--)
			*(unsigned char *)ptr = (unsigned char) value;
		for (; len >= (int)sizeof(int); ptr += sizeof(int),
						len -= sizeof(int))
			*(unsigned int *)ptr = cint;
		for (; len != 0; ptr++, len--)
			*(unsigned char *)ptr = (unsigned char) value;
		atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_seq_cst);
	}
	return retlen;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (io->ops.block_set) {
		(*io->ops.block_set)(
			io, offset, value, memory_order_seq_cst, len);
	} else {
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in this fragment. The code calls a function-pointer io->ops.block_set; it does not itself call any <string.h> functions. Earlier code bounds-checks len (if ((offset + len) > io->size) len = io->size - offset) and checks ptr for NULL, so the parameters passed are already bounded. Whether the called block_set implementation uses string.h and respects bounds is outside this fragment and must be verified in that implementation, but this fragment does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
